results.title: X-files = X files. Season 2. Box set
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The X-files = The X files”.
Season one of “The X-Files” concluded with the government shutting down the X-files project leaving agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) relieved of their special duties. At the commencement of Season two (Ep. 1 ‘Little green men’) Scully and Mulder have been deliberately kept apart by unknown government forces and are back doing rank and file FBI investigations. Believing that the agency keeps them under constant surveillance, Scully and Mulder must now meet in secret. Agent Mulder has lost hope in ever finding ‘the truth’ behind his sisters alien abduction, while agent Scully has become despondent with her extra-ordinary FBI teaching duties. Of course that doesn’t last and the two find themselves together again investigating a recent UFO sighting in Puerto Rico which the government is desperately trying to cover up. The second season delves even deeper into the mythologies set up in season one, accumulating with agent Scully’s abduction (Ep. 5 ‘Duane Barry’) and agent Mulder discovering some shocking revelations about his sister’s disappearance (Ep. 16 ‘Colony’). In season two creator Chris Carter creates a nice role reversal between the agents, as the scientifically minded Scully begins to entertain the existence of extraterrestrial life, while Mulder begins to lose interest in finding out the ‘truth’. Season two also sees the introduction of Krycek (Nicholas Lea), a duplicitous FBI agent who is initially assigned as Mulder’s partner when Scully goes missing (Ep. 4 ‘Sleepless’). Cast also includes William B. Davis and Mitch Pileggi.

results.title: X-files = X files. Season 1. Box set
results.brief_description: Season one of this long running cult series which explores the paranormal and the paranoid, introduces us to the covert world of FBI agents Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) and Fox Mulder (David Duchovny). In the pilot series agent Dana Scully is assigned to a new project- the X-files - reserved for unsolved cases with a paranormal twist. The man leading these investigations is agent Fox Mulder or Spooky Mulder as he is known by his mocking co-workers. During the first season creator Chris Carter guides us through a labyrinth of secret plots, covert organizations within organizations, and insidious extraterrestrial conspiracy theories. Throughout the first season we are also introduced to a slew of mysterious recurring characters such as Mulder’s secret FBI source Deep throat (Jerry Hardin) (Ep. 2 ‘Deep throat’); the government watchdog group, ‘The Lone gunmen’ (a kind of think tank for all things conspiracy based); and the menacing ‘cancer man’ (William B. Davis). Part of the show’s popularity is due to the unusual relationship between Scully and Mulder. Carter presents a platonic relationship between a man and a woman with all its subtle shifts and changes without having to resort to the standard resolution of romance and sex. Actors Gillian Anderson and David Duchovny are key to the shows success, creating genuine chemistry and a subtle sexual tension between them. Through the 24 episodes that make up season one we discover why Mulder has invested so much of his life in investigating these unexplained phenomena (Ep. 4 ‘Conduit’), while also witnessing Scully’s gradual journey from cynic to true believer. Chris Carter’s original agenda with the “X-Files” was to create a program in the vein of the 70s cult horror series “The Night stalker.” His vision became a television phenomenon which ran for nine years, was made into a feature film and generated a fiercely loyal fan base with hundreds of web-sites dedicated to the show and its characters.

results.title: Wyrd sisters: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte two
results.brief_description: This tape contains episodes four to six of this discworld adventure. If someone thrust a new-born baby into your arms and told you to look after it, what would you do? And suppose you had a sneaking suspicion it was no ordinary baby? And suppose again you were Granny Weatherwax - the most practical and pragmatic of a trio of ill-assorted witches. For it is these three that become involved in not just witchcraft but good and evil, ghostly torment and worst of all - amateur dramatics!

results.title: Wyrd sisters: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte one
results.brief_description: Great A’Tuin is a giant turtle, floating through space, and on his back stand four elephants, on their backs, there rests the Discworld. This is the setting for Terry Pratchett’s adventure, the ‘Discworld’. This tape contains episodes one to three. In these epsiodes witch Granny Weatherwax finds a baby like no other. There is also stately matters afoot, and with the assistance of her companions Magrat and Nanny Ogg, they go to extreme lengths to deliver the recognition that the King, who has been ousted by the wretched Duke, deserves.

results.title: Wyperfeld
results.brief_description: Wyperfeld National Park in North-western Victoria: its birds, animals, wildflowers and trees. The Ranger travels through the sand dunes of the Mallee country, stopping at a bore to pump water. Birds gather to drink - galahs, crested pigeons, ringneck parrots, honeyeaters, ravens and white cockatoos. Kangaroos, emus and the bushy-tailed possum abound amongst stands of red gums and Murray pine, and wildflowers seen include the white ever-lasting and Austral beauties. Bird watchers visiting the park study the beautiful Mallee fowl. Camera, editing and script: David Corke. Music: George Dreyfus Assistance and location recording: Peter Bruce. Park Ranger: Alec Campbell.

results.title: Wynken, Blynken and Nod
results.brief_description: Barbara Cooney has lent her delicate talent to the gentle and dreamlike illustrations that illuminate the haunting beauty of this poem, now a part of the permanent treasury of poems for children.

results.title: Wyatt Earp
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Kasdan Pictures and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Wyatt Earp was one of the most famous lawmen of the american Wild West. With his friend Doc Holliday, Earp and his brothers tried to keep law and order in a land where lawlessness and violence was a way of life. Kevin Costner stars as Wyatt Earp in this epic production and is ably supported by Gene Hackman who plays Earp’s strong-willed father, and Dennis Quaid who is excellent as the sickly but lethal Doc Holliday.

results.title: Wuthering heights [Cavanah]
results.creator_credit: David Skynner, Louise Berridge, WGBH (Boston) and LWT
results.brief_description: Based on Emily Bronte’s 1847 novel, this production professes to differ from other adaptations by covering the complete story and adhering closely to the spirit of the original text. This includes an emphasis on supernatural forces which contribute to the demise of the characters. Cast includes Robert Cavanah, Orla Brady and Peter Davison.
